examples/dbpedia.php
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 <?php
00002 /**
00003  * Example of grabbing and parsing Linked Data from DBPedia.
00004  *
00005  * This example illustrates how QueryPath can be used to do the following:
00006  * 
00007  * - Make a robust HTTP connection to a remote server to fetch data.
00008  * - Using context to control the underlying stream.
00009  * - Working with Linked Data.
00010  * - Work with XML Namespaces in documents.
00011  *   * Using namespaces to access elements in selectors
00012  *   * Using namespaces to access attributes in selectors
00013  *   * Using namespaces to access attributes in XML methods.
00014  *
00015  * The code here connects to the DBPedia server and looks up the Linked
00016  * Data stored there for a particular Wikipedia entry (any Wikipedia
00017  * wiki name should work here).
00018  * 
00019  * 
00020  * @author M Butcher <matt@aleph-null.tv>
00021  * @license LGPL The GNU Lesser GPL (LGPL) or an MIT-like license.
00022  * @see http://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
00023  * @see http://dbpedia.org
00024  * @see sparql.php
00025  * @see musicbrainz.php
00026  */
00027 
00028 require_once '../src/QueryPath/QueryPath.php';
00029 
00030 // The URL to look up (any of these works):
00031 $url = 'http://dbpedia.org/data/The_Beatles.rdf';
00032 //$url = 'http://dbpedia.org/data/Swansea.rdf';
00033 //$url = 'http://dbpedia.org/data/The_Lord_of_the_Rings.rdf';
00034 // HTTP headers:
00035 $headers = array(
00036   'Accept: application/rdf,application/rdf+xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8',
00037   'Accept-Language: en-us,en',
00038   'Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1,utf-8',
00039   'User-Agent: QueryPath/1.2',
00040 );
00041 
00042 // The context options:
00043 $options = array(
00044   'http' => array(
00045     'method' => 'GET',
00046     'protocol_version' => 1.1,
00047     'header' => implode("\r\n", $headers),
00048   ),
00049 );
00050 
00051 // Create a stream context that will tell QueryPath how to 
00052 // load the file.
00053 $cxt = stream_context_create($options);
00054 
00055 // Fetch the URL and select all rdf:Description elements.
00056 // (Note that | is the CSS 3 equiv of colons for namespacing.)
00057 // To add the context, we pass it in as an option to QueryPath.
00058 $qp = qp($url, 'rdf|Description', array('context' => $cxt));
00059 //$qp = qp('The_Beatles.rdf');
00060 
00061 printf("There are %d descriptions in this record.\n", $qp->size());
00062 
00063 // Here, we use rdf|* to select all elements in the RDF namespace.
00064 $qp->top()->find('rdf|*');
00065 printf("There are %d RDF items in this record.\n", $qp->size());
00066 
00067 // Standard pseudo-classes that are not HTML specific can be used on 
00068 // namespaced elements, too.
00069 print "About: " . $qp->top()->find('rdfs|label:first')->text() . PHP_EOL;
00070 print "About (FOAF): " . $qp->top()->find('foaf|name:first')->text() . PHP_EOL;
00071 
00072 // Namespaced attributes can be retrieved using the same sort of delimiting.
00073 print "\nComment:\n";
00074 print $qp->top()->find('rdfs|comment[xml|lang="en"]')->text();
00075 print PHP_EOL;
00076 
00077 $qp->top();
00078 
00079 print "\nImages:\n";
00080 foreach ($qp->branch()->find('foaf|img') as $img) {
00081   // Note that when we use attr() we are using the XML name, NOT 
00082   // the CSS 3 name. So it is rdf:resource, not rdf|resource.
00083   // The same goes for the tag() function -- it will return 
00084   // the full element name (e.g. rdf:Description).
00085   print $img->attr('rdf:resource') . PHP_EOL;
00086 }
00087 
00088 print "\nImages Galleries:\n";
00089 foreach ($qp->branch()->find('dbpprop|hasPhotoCollection') as $img) {
00090   print $img->attr('rdf:resource') . PHP_EOL;
00091 }
00092 
00093 print "\nOther Sites:\n";
00094 foreach ($qp->branch()->find('foaf|page') as $img) {
00095   print $img->attr('rdf:resource') . PHP_EOL;
00096 }
00097 
00098 //$qp->writeXML();
